intro: Alicastrum rubescens, commonly known as the red-leafed alicastrum, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking red foliage and showy pink to purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Alicastrum rubescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
